Hello all-

Some of you have asked for the source code of my HyperNEAT experiments (so
far).

I kept putting off publishing the code until I had time to clean up the
code. Instead of further delay, I am just releasing it as is.

Here is a link to it:

http://tinyurl.com/JeffCluneHyperNEATcode

The most requested code--that for evolving gaits for simulated quadruped
robots--is in here as the LegSwingExperiment. There is a readme file for how
to get started. If you have any questions, just let me know.

PS. I think it would be fun to have the robot experiment included in the
more canonical HyperNEAT releases, if the maintainers of those packages are
interested. It is very fun to watch the robots evolve, and it quickly gives
one a sense of the difference in behaviors produced by HyperNEAT vs. NEAT
and FT-NEAT. I have found that being able to download a package and see
something that is visually intuitive can often engage an enthusiast/hobbyist
who does not immediately know how to evaluate improved performance on more
abstract problems (e.g. the boxes domain). So, it would be nice to have
something like this for them to immediately see and play with. Just a
thought. 

Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University
jclune@...
www.msu.edu/~jclune
